Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Narendra Modi was made the 'chairman' of the World Health Organization, which is not true.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Indian Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan was elected chair of the WHO's Executive Board, not Narendra Modi.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or support for the assertion that Narendra Modi became the WHO chairman.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Narendra Modi was appointed as the chairman of the WHO without any basis or evidence.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no indication that the claim falters at times.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation presented in the claim.
